verse: Then God blessed Noah and his sons and said to them, “·Have many children; grow in number [Be fruitful and multiply] and fill the earth [1:22, 29].

Every ·animal [living thing] on earth, every bird in the ·sky [heavens], every animal that crawls on the ground, and every fish in the sea will ·respect [fear] and ·fear [dread; be terrified of] you. I have given them ·to you [into your hand].
“Everything that moves, everything that is alive, is yours for food. Earlier I gave you the green plants [1:29–30], but now I give you everything for food.
But you must not eat ·meat [flesh] that still has blood in it, because blood ·gives [is] life [Lev. 3:17; 7:26–27; 17:10–14].

I will ·demand [require; seek] blood for life. I will ·demand [require; seek] the life of any animal that kills a person, and I will ·demand [require; seek] the life of anyone who takes another person’s life.

“As for you, Noah, ·I want you and your family to have many children, to grow in number on the earth, and to become many [be fruitful and multiply, swarm/teem over the earth and multiply on it; 9:1].”
Then God said to Noah and his sons,
“·Now [or Look] I am making my ·agreement [covenant; treaty; 6:18] with you and your ·people [seed] ·who will live after you [after you],

and with every living thing that is with you—the birds, the ·tame [livestock; cattle] and the wild animals, and with everything that came out of the ·boat [ark] with you—with every living thing on earth.

I ·make [establish] this ·agreement [covenant; treaty; 6:18] with you: ·I will never again destroy all living things by a flood [a flood will never again cut off all flesh]. A flood will never again destroy the earth.”

And God said, “This is the sign [a symbol that represents this relationship between God and Noah; 17:11; Ex. 31:13, 17] of the ·agreement [covenant; treaty; 6:18] between me and you and every living creature that is with you for all future generations.
I am putting my ·rainbow [bow; may represent God hanging up his weapon after warring against humanity] in the clouds as the sign of the ·agreement [covenant; treaty; 6:18] between me and the earth.
When I bring clouds over the earth and a ·rainbow [bow] appears in them,
I will remember my ·agreement [covenant; treaty; 6:18] between me and you and every living thing [of all flesh]. [The waters of the] Floods will never again destroy all ·life on the earth [flesh].

When the ·rainbow [bow] appears in the clouds, I will see it and I will remember the ·agreement that continues forever [eternal covenant] between me and every living thing [of all flesh] on the earth.”
So God said to Noah, “·The rainbow [This] is a ·sign [9:12] of the ·agreement [covenant; treaty; 6:18] that I made with all living things on earth.”

These three men were Noah’s sons, and all the people on earth ·came [spread out; see the genealogy in ch. 10] from these three sons.
Noah ·became a farmer [was the first man of the ground/soil] and planted a vineyard.
When he drank ·wine made from his grapes [the wine], he became drunk and lay ·naked [uncovered] in his tent.
Ham, the father of Canaan, looked at his naked father and told his [two] brothers outside [an act of disrespect; he should have helped his father, as in the next verse].
